ground_truth: A metallic shield with the letters WB moves slowly forward out of darkness. A heap of skulls and bones is piled high behind iron railings. From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large snake. Flickering its tongue, it slithers down onto a narrow path and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery. The reptile's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven path. The snake slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark, glowering sky. A huge dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night sky. A light is switched on in a cottage nearby. A disheveled old man lights the gas and puts on a kettle. He takes the top off a teapot, and picks up a tea bag. Through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big house. He throws down the tea bag angrily and takes a bunch of keys from a hook, and leaves the cottage, lighting his way with a large torch. He stumbles across the uneven ground towards the big house. He hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large wooden door. Inside the house, the strong beam of the old man's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister, he starts to climb the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. He turns off his torch as he hears voices from an open doorway. The snake appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in a flash of green light. In the cottage, the kettle boils. Harry jerks awake. Ron flops back onto his pillow. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a wood. A boy drops down. They climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky. They all touch the boot which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily. Harry looks up and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Harry up. They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic campsite. Jugglers entertain the crowd as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-man tent. Harry gawks. Inside the tiny tent, he sees a vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A metal barrier with the characters WB advances gradually forward out of obscurity. A mound of skulls and bones is stacked high behind iron fences. From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large serpent. Flickering its tongue, it slithers down onto a narrow trail and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown graveyard. The reptile's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven trail. The serpent slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe. Metallic silver characters appear in the dark, glowering sky. A huge dilapidated mansion stands silhouetted against the night sky. A light is switched on in a cottage nearby. A disheveled old man lights the gas and puts on a kettle. He takes the lid off a teapot, and picks up a tea bag. Through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big mansion. He throws down the tea bag angrily and takes a bunch of keys from a hook, and leaves the cottage, lighting his way with a large flashlight. He stumbles across the uneven terrain towards the big mansion. He hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large wooden door. Inside the mansion, the strong beam of the old man's flashlight flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the wooden railing, he starts to ascend the bare stairs, his flashlight casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. He turns off his flashlight as he hears voices from an open doorway. The serpent appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in a flash of green light. In the cottage, the kettle boils. Harry jerks awake. Ron flops back onto his pillow. Mr. Weasley leads his party through a forest. A boy drops down. They climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky. They all touch the boot which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily. Harry looks up and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Harry up. They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun rises as they gaze down on a gigantic campsite. Jugglers amuse the crowd as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-person tent. Harry gawks. Inside the tiny tent, he sees a vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB is moved slowly forward out of darkness. An iron railing piles high a heap of skulls and bones. The grinning mouth of a skull is emerged from by the head of a large snake. Flickering its tongue, a narrow path is slithered down onto by it, and the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery are silently moved between by it. The uneven path is glided swiftly along as the reptile's lithe body shimmers. Past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe, the snake is slid. Metallic silver letters glow in the dark sky. The night sky silhouettes a huge dilapidated house. Someone switches on a light in a nearby cottage. The gas is lit by a disheveled old man, and a kettle is put on. He takes the top off a teapot and a tea bag is picked up by him. Through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big house. The tea bag is thrown down angrily by him, and a bunch of keys is taken from a hook and the cottage is left by him, lighting his way with a large torch. The uneven ground towards the big house is stumbled across by him. The stone steps to the large wooden door are hauled up unsteadily by him. Inside the house, dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs are flickered over by the strong beam of the old man's torch. The wooden banister is grasped by him as the un-carpeted stairs are started to climb, his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. His torch is turned off by him as voices from an open doorway are heard. The doorway is slithered through by the snake towards a figure hidden in an armchair. A flash of green light engulfs the old man. In the cottage, the boiling of the kettle is done. Harry is jerked awake. Ron flops back onto his pillow. A group is led through a wood by Mr. Weasley. A boy drops down. A grassy slope is climbed by them. The faint glow of dawn is appeared in the sky. The boot is all touched by them which is begun to spin like a Catherine wheel. With it, they are pulled, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily. Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley are looked up and seen by Harry, hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Harry up. The others are followed along a cliff top overlooking the sea. As they look down on a gigantic campsite, the sun rises. The crowd is entertained by jugglers as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks dangerously fly low. To a shabby two-man tent, they are led by Mr. Weasley. Harry gawks. He sees a vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas inside the tiny tent.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB emerges from darkness. Behind iron railings, a heap of skulls and bones is piled high. A large snake's head emerges from a skull's mouth, flickers its tongue, and slithers silently between gravestones in an overgrown cemetery. The snake glides past a stone statue of a winged skeleton in a hooded cloak holding a scythe. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark sky. A dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night. A light switches on in a nearby cottage. A disheveled old man lights the gas and puts on a kettle. Noticing a light in the big house, he angrily throws down a tea bag, grabs keys, and leaves, lighting his way with a torch. He stumbles across uneven ground to the big house, climbs the stone steps, and enters. Inside, his torch flickers over dusty paneling and a cobwebbed grandfather clock. Grasping the banister, he climbs the stairs, casting eerie shadows. Hearing voices, he turns off his torch. The snake slithers through a doorway toward a figure in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in green light. In the cottage, the kettle boils. Harry jerks awake, and Ron flops back onto his pillow. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a wood. They climb a grassy slope as dawn appears. They touch a boot, spinning like a Catherine wheel, and are pulled into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins land heavily. Harry sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking down. Cedric helps Harry up, and they follow along a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun rises over a gigantic campsite. Jugglers entertain as more tents are erected, and people on broomsticks fly low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-man tent. Harry gawks at the vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with WB letters emerges from darkness. Behind iron railings, skulls and bones pile high. A snake's head emerges from a skull, slithering silently through a dark cemetery. It glides past a winged skeleton statue. Metallic letters appear in the sky. A dilapidated house is silhouetted against the night. A nearby cottage light turns on. An old man lights the gas, puts on a kettle, and notices the big house's light. Angrily, he grabs keys and a torch, stumbling towards the house. Inside, his torch flickers over dusty paneling and a cobwebbed clock. Hearing voices, he turns off the torch. The snake slithers towards a figure in an armchair. A green flash engulfs the old man. The kettle boils in the cottage. Harry wakes, Ron relaxes. Mr. Weasley leads a group through woods, climbing a slope as dawn glows. They touch a spinning boot, pulled into bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins land heavily. Harry sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley descending. Cedric helps Harry up. They follow along a cliff, overlooking a campsite. Jugglers entertain, and broomstick riders fly low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby tent. Inside, Harry sees a vast interior with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A metallic shield, emblazoned with the prominent letters WB, gradually and deliberately moves forward, emerging from the depths of darkness. Behind it, a daunting heap of skulls and bones is piled high, confined by imposing iron railings. From the grinning mouth of one of these skulls, the head of a large, menacing snake emerges. With its tongue flickering in and out, the snake slithers down onto a narrow, winding path, moving silently and stealthily between the gravestones in a dark, overgrown cemetery. The reptile's lithe, sinuous body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven, shadowy path. The snake slides past a stone statue, a haunting figure of a skeleton with enormous wings, draped in a hooded cloak and ominously holding a scythe. In the dark, glowering sky above, metallic silver letters appear, casting an eerie glow. A huge, dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night sky, its presence foreboding. Nearby, a light flickers on in a small, humble cottage. Inside, a disheveled old man lights the gas and sets a kettle on to boil. He removes the top from a teapot and picks up a tea bag. Through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big, looming house. Frustrated, he throws down the tea bag angrily, grabs a bunch of keys from a hook, and leaves the cottage, lighting his way with a large, powerful torch. He stumbles across the uneven ground, making his way towards the big house. With effort, he hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large, imposing wooden door. Inside the house, the strong beam of the old man's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister for support, he begins to climb the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie, dancing shadows over the paneled walls. He turns off his torch as he hears voices emanating from an open doorway. The snake reappears, slithering through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. Suddenly, the old man is engulfed in a flash of bright green light. Back in the cottage, the kettle boils, its whistle piercing the silence. Harry jerks awake, startled. Ron flops back onto his pillow, still groggy. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a dense wood. A boy drops down, and they all climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn begins to appear in the sky, casting a soft light. They all touch the boot, which starts to spin rapidly like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled along with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright, blinding light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily on the ground. Harry looks up and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric extends a hand and helps Harry up. Together, they follow the others along a cliff top that overlooks the vast, expansive sea. As the sun rises, they gaze down upon a gigantic campsite. Jugglers entertain the crowd below as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low, adding to the excitement. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby, worn-out two-man tent. Harry gawks in amazement. Inside the tiny tent, he is astonished to see a vast interior, furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas, defying its modest exterior.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
A gleaming metallic shield, prominently adorned with the bold, noticeable letters "WB," gradually and with a deliberate pace, advances forward as it emerges from the profound, enveloping depths of darkness. Looming behind this imposing shield is a daunting, almost intimidating pile of skulls and bones stacked high, confined and restricted by sturdy, imposing iron railings. Eerily, from the grinning, menacing mouth of one such skull, the head of a large, threatening snake emerges. Its tongue flickers in and out with a smooth, rhythmic motion as the snake slithers sinuously down onto a narrow, winding path, moving in a silent and stealthy manner through the gravestones scattered in a dark, wild, and overgrown cemetery. The reptile's sleek, lithe body scintillates with a subtle shimmer as it glides swiftly and gracefully along the uneven, shadowy path. 

The snake slides by a stone statue, a haunting, ghostly figure of a skeleton with enormous, expansive wings, draped in a hooded cloak, ominously clutching a scythe. In the dark, oppressive sky overhead, metallic silver letters materialize, casting an eerie, otherworldly glow that illuminates the scene. A huge, dilapidated, and foreboding house stands silhouetted against the night sky, its presence exuding an overwhelming sense of dread. Nearby, a light flickers to life in a small, unpretentious, humble cottage. Inside this modest abode, a disheveled, somewhat haggard old man lights the gas and sets a kettle on to boil. He methodically removes the top from a teapot and picks up a solitary tea bag. Through the kitchen window, he notices with irritation a light in the big, looming house. Frustrated, he throws the tea bag down with anger, forcefully grabs a bunch of keys from a hook, and strides out of the cottage, lighting his way with a large, powerful torch. He stumbles over the uneven ground, determinedly making his way towards the large, imposing house. 

With significant effort, he hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the massive wooden door that dominates the entrance. Once inside the house, the strong, focused beam of his torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock that is festooned with a thick layer of cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister for support and stability, he begins the arduous climb up the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie, dancing shadows over the paneled walls. As he proceeds, he turns off his torch upon hearing mysterious voices emanating ominously from an open doorway. The snake reappears, slithering stealthily through the doorway towards a figure hidden in the shadows of an armchair. Suddenly, the old man is engulfed in a bright, blinding flash of green light. Meanwhile, back in the small, cozy cottage, the kettle boils, its whistle piercing and shattering the silence. Harry jerks awake, startled by the sudden noise. Ron flops back onto his pillow, still groggy and half-asleep. 

Mr. Weasley leads his group through a dense, overgrown wood. A boy drops down from view, and they all climb together up a grassy, inclined slope. The faint, soft glow of dawn begins to appear in the sky, casting a gentle, welcoming light. They all reach out to touch the boot, which suddenly begins to spin rapidly, much like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled along with the boot, spinning faster and faster, until they are engulfed in a bright, blinding light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily on the ground, somewhat dazed. Harry looks up to see Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking sedately and steadily back down to Earth. Cedric extends a helping hand and assists Harry to his feet. Together, they follow the others along a cliff top that offers a breathtaking view of the vast, expansive sea. As the sun rises majestically in the sky, they gaze down upon a gigantic, sprawling campsite. Jugglers entertain the growing crowd below as even more tents are skillfully erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low, adding a sense of thrill and excitement to the scene. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby, worn-out two-man tent. Harry gapes in amazement and astonishment. Inside the tiny tent, he is utterly amazed to find a vast interior, lavishly furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas, defying the tent's modest, unassuming exterior.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A metallic shield emblazoned with the letters WB gradually emerges from the enveloping darkness, moving forward with deliberate slowness. Behind iron railings, a macabre heap of skulls and bones is stacked high, creating an eerie backdrop. From the grinning mouth of one skull, the head of a large snake emerges, its forked tongue flickering in and out as it begins to slither down onto a narrow path. The snake moves silently, weaving its way between gravestones in a cemetery that is both dark and overgrown, its lithe body shimmering as it glides swiftly along the uneven path. As it continues its journey, the snake slides past a stone statue depicting a skeleton with enormous wings, draped in a hooded cloak and clutching a scythe. In the dark, glowering sky above, metallic silver letters materialize, casting an ominous presence. Silhouetted against the night sky stands a huge, dilapidated house, its outline stark and foreboding. Nearby, a light flickers on in a small cottage, where a disheveled old man is seen lighting the gas and setting a kettle on to boil. He removes the top of a teapot and picks up a tea bag, but as he glances through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big house. Frustration overtakes him, and he throws down the tea bag in anger, snatches a bunch of keys from a hook, and exits the cottage, illuminating his path with a large torch. He stumbles across the uneven ground, making his way toward the imposing house. With effort, he hauls himself up the stone steps to the large wooden door. Once inside, the strong beam of his torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock draped in cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister for support, he begins to climb the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. As he nears an open doorway, he turns off his torch upon hearing voices emanating from within. The snake reappears, slithering through the doorway toward a figure obscured in an armchair. Suddenly, the old man is engulfed in a flash of green light. Meanwhile, back in the cottage, the kettle reaches a boil. Harry jerks awake from his slumber, while Ron flops back onto his pillow, seeking more rest. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a dense wood, and as they progress, a boy drops down, and they all begin to climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn starts to appear in the sky, casting a gentle light over their path. They gather around and touch a boot, which begins to spin rapidly like a Catherine wheel. As it spins faster and faster, they are pulled along with it into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins release their grip and land heavily on the ground. Harry looks up to see Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley descending sedately back to Earth. Cedric extends a hand to help Harry up, and together they follow the others along a cliff top that overlooks the sea. As the sun rises, they gaze down upon a gigantic campsite bustling with activity. Jugglers entertain the crowd, and more tents are being erected, while people on broomsticks fly dangerously low overhead. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-man tent, and Harry gawks in amazement. Inside the seemingly tiny tent, he discovers a vast interior, lavishly furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas, defying its modest exterior appearance.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB emerges from darkness, revealing a heap of skulls and bones behind iron railings. A large snake slithers from a skull's mouth, gliding silently along a narrow path through an overgrown cemetery, past a stone statue of a winged skeleton. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark sky as a dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night. Nearby, a disheveled old man lights the gas in his cottage, preparing tea. Noticing a light in the big house, he angrily abandons his tea, grabs a bunch of keys, and heads out with a torch. He stumbles across the uneven ground, climbs the stone steps, and enters the house. Inside, his torch flickers over dusty paneling and a cobwebbed grandfather clock. He ascends the stairs, turning off his torch upon hearing voices. The snake slithers through a doorway towards a hidden figure, and the old man is engulfed in a flash of green light. Meanwhile, in the cottage, the kettle boils as Harry jerks awake and Ron flops back onto his pillow. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a wood, climbing a grassy slope as dawn breaks. They all touch a spinning boot, which pulls them into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins land heavily, and Cedric helps Harry up. They follow the others along a cliff top, overlooking a gigantic campsite as the sun rises. Jugglers entertain the crowd, and people on broomsticks fly low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-man tent, where Harry is amazed to find a vast interior with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB, an emblem known to represent Warner Bros., moves slowly forward out of darkness. A heap of skulls and bones is piled high behind iron railings, reminiscent of ancient burial grounds found in European ossuaries. From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large snake, a symbol often associated with death and rebirth in various cultures. Flickering its tongue, it slithers down onto a narrow path and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery, similar to the historic cemeteries in Highgate, London. The reptile's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven path. The snake slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe, an image evocative of the Grim Reaper, a personification of death. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark, glowering sky, forming ominous words of foreboding. A huge dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night sky, similar to the decrepit manors found in Gothic literature. A light is switched on in a cottage nearby. A disheveled old man lights the gas, an archaic method of warming water, and puts on a kettle. He takes the top off a teapot, and picks up a tea bag, a quintessential British habit. Through the kitchen window, he notices a light in the big house, a place known for its mysterious past. He throws down the tea bag angrily and takes a bunch of keys from a hook, and leaves the cottage, lighting his way with a large torch, a practical tool in rural England. He stumbles across the uneven ground towards the big house. He hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large wooden door. Inside the house, the strong beam of the old man's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs, reminiscent of an era long past. Grasping the wooden banister, he starts to climb the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. He turns off his torch as he hears voices from an open doorway, suggesting an unexpected presence. The snake appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in a flash of green light, a color often associated with magic and mystery in folklore. In the cottage, the kettle boils. Harry jerks awake, startled from his dream. Ron flops back onto his pillow, still cocooned in sleep. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a wood, the air filled with the scent of pine and earth. A boy drops down as they climb a grassy slope, eager yet weary. The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky, bathing the landscape in soft light. They all touch the boot, an old shoe transformed into a Portkey, which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel, a fireworks item named after Saint Catherine of Alexandria. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily, feeling the disorientation of magical travel. Harry looks up and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth, a controlled descent from their magical journey. Cedric helps Harry up, offering friendship and support. They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea, the waves crashing below. The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic campsite, alive with excitement for the Quidditch World Cup. Jugglers entertain the crowd as even more tents are erected, adding to the festive atmosphere. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low, a thrilling but risky spectacle. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby two-man tent, outwardly unimpressive. Harry gawks. Inside the tiny tent, he sees a vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas, a marvel of magical expansion unseen by Muggles.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB moves slowly forward out of darkness. A heap of skulls and bones is piled high behind iron railings. From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large snake. Flickering its tongue it slithers down onto a narrow path and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery. The reptile's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven path. The snake slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark glowering sky. A huge dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night sky. A light is switched on in a cottage nearby. Inside the house the strong beam of the old man's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister he starts to climb the uncarpeted stairs his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. He turns off his torch as he hears voices from an open doorway. The snake appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in a flash of green light. In the cottage the kettle boils. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Harry jerks awake. Ron flops back onto his pillow. Mr Weasley leads his group through a wood. A boy drops down. They climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky. They all touch the boot which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled with it spinning faster and faster into a bright light. Ginny Hermione. Ron Harry and the twins let go and land heavily. Harry looks up and sees Mr Diggory. Cedric and Mr Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Harry up. They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic campsite. Jugglers entertain the crowd as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low. Mr Weasley leads them to a shabby twoman tent. Harry gawks. Inside the tiny tent. he sees a vast interior furnished with carpets beds and sofas.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB moves slowly forward out of darkness. A heap of skulls and bones is piled high behind iron railings. From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large dragonfly. Flickering its tongue, it skates down onto a narrow path and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery. The bird's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven path. The dragonfly slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe. Metallic silver letters appear in the dark, glowering sky. A huge dilapidated ship stands silhouetted against the night sky. A light is switched on in a cottage nearby. A disheveled young woman lights the gas and puts on a kettle. She takes the top off a teapot and picks up a tea bag. Through the kitchen window, she notices a light in the big house. She throws down the tea bag angrily and takes a bunch of keys from a hook, and leaves the cottage, lighting her way with a large torch. She stumbles across the uneven ground towards the big house. She hauls herself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large wooden door. Inside the house, the strong beam of the young woman's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the wooden banister, she starts to climb the un-carpeted stairs, her torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. She turns off her torch as she hears voices from an open doorway. The dragonfly appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The young woman is engulfed in a flash of green light. In the cottage, the kettle boils. Hermione jerks awake. Neville flops back onto his pillow. Professor McGonagall leads her group through a wood. An owl drops down. They climb a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky. They all touch the boot which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Luna, Hagrid, Snape, Hermione, and the twins let go and land heavily. Hermione looks up and sees Professor Sprout, Cedric, and Professor McGonagall hiking sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Hermione up. They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic campsite. Jugglers entertain the crowd as even more tents are erected. People on broomsticks fly dangerously low. Professor McGonagall leads them to a shabby two-man tent. Hermione gawks. Inside the tiny tent, she sees a vast interior furnished with carpets, beds, and sofas.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A metallic armor plate with the letters XY moves slowly forward out of shadows. A mound of sand and rocks is piled high behind wooden fences. From the grinning mouth of a helmet emerges the head of a large turtle. Flickering its beak, it crawls down onto a narrow trail and moves silently between the flowerbeds in a dark and overgrown garden. The turtle's thick shell glimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven trail. The turtle slides past a stone statue of a knight with huge wings, draped in a robe and holding a trident. Metallic silver numbers appear in the dark, foreboding sky. A huge dilapidated factory stands silhouetted against the night sky. A light is switched on in a cabin nearby. A disheveled old woman lights the stove and puts on a pot. She takes the lid off a jar, and picks up a spoon. Through the kitchen window, she notices a light in the large factory. She throws down the spoon angrily and takes a bunch of coins from a shelf, and leaves the cabin, lighting her way with a large lantern. She stumbles across the uneven ground towards the large factory. She hauls herself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large metal door. Inside the factory, the strong beam of the old woman's lantern flickers over dusty metal walls and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Grasping the metal railing, she starts to climb the un-carpeted stairs, her lantern casting eerie shadows over the metal walls. She turns off her lantern as she hears voices from an open window. The turtle appears and crawls through the window towards a figure hidden in a recliner. The old woman is engulfed in a flash of blue light. In the cabin, the pot boils. Harry jerks awake. Ron flops back onto his mattress. Mr. Weasley leads his group through a forest. A boy jumps down. They climb a rocky slope. The faint glow of dawn appears in the clouds. They all touch the shoe which begins to spin like a windmill. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a bright light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins let go and land heavily. Harry looks up and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley strolling sedately down to Earth. Cedric helps Harry up. They follow the others along a hilltop overlooking the desert. The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic carnival. Acrobats entertain the crowd as even more stalls are erected. People on bicycles ride dangerously low. Mr. Weasley leads them to a shabby four-man tent. Harry gawks. Inside the tiny tent, he sees a vast interior furnished with tiles, hammocks, and chairs.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB drifts lazily out of darkness. A heap of skulls and bones is thrown loosely behind iron railings. From the grinning mouth of a skull bursts the head of a large snake. Flickering its tongue, it slips down onto a narrow path and crawls silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery. The reptile's lithe body glimmers as it slides gently along the uneven path. The snake crawls past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings, draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe. Metallic silver letters vanish in the dark, glowering sky. A huge dilapidated house stands suspended against the night sky. A light vanishes in a cottage nearby. A disheveled old man extinguishes the gas and picks up a kettle. He places the lid on a teapot, and tosses a tea bag. Through the kitchen window, he observes a light in the big house. He snatches up the tea bag angrily and grabs a bunch of keys from a hook, and enters the cottage, darkening his way with a large torch. He stumbles across the uneven ground away from the big house. He lowers himself unsteadily down the stone steps to the large wooden door. Inside the house, the strong beam of the old man's torch wavers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs. Holding the wooden banister, he descends the un-carpeted stairs, his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls. He turns on his torch as he hears voices from a closed doorway. The snake appears and slithers past the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair. The old man is engulfed in a flash of red light. In the cottage, the kettle cools. Harry rises awake. Ron flops forward onto his pillow. Mr. Weasley follows his group through a wood. A boy climbs up. They descend a grassy slope. The faint glow of dawn vanishes into the sky. They all lift the boot which begins to tilt like a Catherine wheel. They are tugged with it, swinging slower and slower, into a dim light. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins hold on and land gently. Harry glances down and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley strolling swiftly up to Earth. Cedric pulls Harry down. They leave the others from a cliff top overlooking the sea. The sun descends as they glance up at a gigantic campsite. Jugglers rest the crowd as even more tents are dismantled. People on broomsticks hover cautiously high. Mr. Weasley follows them to a pristine two-man tent. Harry averts his gaze. Inside the tiny tent, he encounters a cramped interior furnished with curtains, tables, and chairs.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A wooden plank with the letters NY moves slowly forward out of fog. A collection of feathers and leaves is piled high behind wooden benches. From the grinning mouth of a bear emerges the head of a small bird. Flickering its wings, it flies down onto a winding trail and moves silently between the sunflowers in a bright and blooming garden. The bird's nimble wings shimmer as it flits swiftly along the uneven trail. The bird flies past a marble sculpture of an angel with large horns, draped in a tattered shawl and holding a lantern. Metallic gold letters appear in the clear, shimmering sky. A massive crumbling castle stands silhouetted against the day sky. A lamp is switched on in an igloo nearby. A sprightly young woman lights the candle and puts on a skillet. She takes the lid off a pot, and picks up a spoon. Through the living room window, she notices a lamp in the large castle. She throws down the spoon angrily and takes a cluster of rings from a chain, and leaves the igloo, lighting her way with a small lantern. She stumbles across the uneven terrain towards the large castle. She hauls herself unsteadily up the marble steps to the narrow steel door. Inside the castle, the dim glow of the young woman's lantern flickers over dusty marble walls and a cuckoo clock festooned with vines. Grasping the iron railing, she starts to descend the carpeted ramp, her lantern casting eerie shadows over the tiled floors. She turns off her lantern as she hears laughter from a sealed archway. The bird appears and flits through the archway towards a silhouette perched in a beanbag. The young woman is engulfed in a flash of purple light. In the igloo, the skillet boils. Michael jerks awake. Sam flops back onto his blanket. Mr. Johnson leads his team through a meadow. A girl falls down. They climb a rocky cliff. The faint glow of sunset appears in the horizon. They all touch the helmet which begins to rotate like a pinwheel. They are pulled with it, spinning faster and faster, into a soft glow. Emily, Maggie, Sam, Michael, and the siblings let go and land gently. Michael looks up and sees Mr. Carter, Ethan, and Mr. Johnson floating swiftly down to Earth. Ethan helps Michael up. They follow the others along a grassy ridge overlooking the canyon. The stars emerge as they look down on a sprawling village. Acrobats amuse the visitors as even more huts are raised. Birds on kites fly dangerously close. Mr. Johnson leads them to a rustic four-man cabin. Michael stares. Inside the tiny cabin, he sees a vast interior adorned with tapestries, chairs, and pillows.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A metallic orb with the letters MF floats gently upward out of shadows. A stack of gears and cogs is arranged high behind wooden fences. From the laughing eyes of a skull emerges the top of a large tortoise. Flicking its tail, it ambles up onto a wide path and drifts quietly beside the flowers in a bright and overgrown garden. The tortoise's sturdy shell sparkles as it crawls slowly along the smooth path. The tortoise crawls past a marble sculpture of a knight with enormous wings, cloaked in a hooded robe and holding a lance. Metallic red numbers appear in the bright, shimmering sky. A colossal pristine castle stands silhouetted against the morning sky. A candle is snuffed out in a mansion nearby. A tidy young woman douses the lamp and unpacks a suitcase. She puts the lid on a saucepan and grabs a recipe book. Through the living room window, she observes a lamp in the grand castle. She tosses the recipe book cheerfully and takes a necklace from a drawer, and exits the mansion, illuminating her way with a small lantern. She trips lightly over the smooth ground towards the grand castle. She pulls herself steadily up the marble stairs to the enormous glass door. Inside the castle, the weak glow of the young woman's lantern flashes over polished stone paneling and a candelabra adorned with flowers. Clutching the iron rail, she descends the wide staircase, her lantern casting bright patterns over the stone walls. She switches on her lantern as she hears laughter from a closed chamber. The tortoise appears and ambles through the chamber towards a silhouette hidden in a rocking chair. The young woman is enveloped in a burst of blue mist. In the mansion, the suitcase closes. Luna stirs awake. Neville rolls onto his mattress. Professor McGonagall escorts her group through a corridor. A girl springs up. They descend a rocky incline. The brilliant glow of morning emerges in the horizon. They all reach for the ribbon which begins to twirl like a pinwheel. They are tugged with it, whirling slower and slower, into a dim shadow. Luna, Neville, Hermione, Draco, and the siblings clutch tightly and land gracefully. Neville peers up and notices Professor Flitwick, Luna, and Professor McGonagall climbing nimbly down from a hill. Luna assists Neville to his feet. They follow the others through a grassy field overlooking the ocean. The moon sets as they gaze out at a vast metropolis. Magicians amuse the audience as even more pavilions are dismantled. People on bicycles pedal lazily high. Professor McGonagall directs them to a grand four-person yurt. Neville marvels. Inside the large yurt, he discovers a diminutive interior decorated with curtains, stools, and armchairs.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A cardboard shield with the letters WB drifts lazily backward into brightness. A stack of helmets and armor is scattered low beside wooden fences. From the silent crest of a helmet emerges the head of a large lizard. Twitching its nose, it crawls up onto a wide lane and dances loudly between the flowerbeds in a bright and manicured park. The lizard's stocky body glows as it skips slowly along the smooth lane. The lizard hops past a marble fountain of a knight with tiny wings, wrapped in a flowing gown and holding a lance. Metallic golden numbers appear in the bright, smiling sky. A grand renovated villa stands framed against the daybreak sky. A bell is rung in a mansion nearby. A spry young woman starts the oven and puts on a skillet. She takes the lid off a saucepan, and grabs a spoon. Through the living room window, she observes a bell ring in the large villa. She sets down the spoon cheerfully and takes a pile of maps from a drawer, and leaves the mansion, illuminating her path with a tiny lantern. She strides across the smooth pavement toward the large villa. She swings herself confidently up the metal steps to the small glass door. Inside the villa, the dim glow of the young woman's lantern dances over polished marble paneling and a cuckoo clock adorned with flowers. Gripping the metal handrail, she begins to descend the carpeted ramp, her lantern casting cheerful shadows over the paneled walls. She extinguishes her lantern as she hears laughter from a closed doorway. The lizard appears and dances through the threshold toward a silhouette perched on a couch. The young woman is enveloped in a flash of blue light. In the mansion, the skillet sizzles. Harry jolts forward. Ron flings himself off the mattress. Mr. Weasley guides his crew through a field. A girl pops up. They descend a sandy slope. The bright glow of dusk emerges in the air. They all press the hat which starts to tumble like a firecracker. They are pushed by it, tumbling slower and slower, into a dim shadow. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Harry, and the twins hold on and float gently. Harry glances sideways and sees Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley drifting serenely up to Mars. Cedric pulls Harry down. They trail the group down a gorge bottom overlooking a lake. The moon sets as they gaze up at a tiny park. Fire eaters charm the gathering as even fewer dancers are assembled. People on parachutes glide safely high. Mr. Weasley guides them to a pristine single-person yurt. Harry gapes. Inside the spacious yurt, he observes a tiny exterior embellished with tiles, hammocks, and stools.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A brass trumpet with the numbers 34 drifts leisurely backward into brightness. A mound of feathers and branches is scattered low within flimsy ropes. From the smiling grin of a pumpkin appears the foot of a tiny mouse. Nibbling its whiskers, it hops up onto a wide avenue and dances loudly among the sunflowers in a bright and maintained park. The animal's fluffy tail glints as it prances slowly along the smooth avenue. The mouse bounces past a glass sculpture of a dragon with small antennas, wrapped in a patched cloak and wielding a brush. Wooden golden numbers arise in the bright, cheerful ocean. A small pristine cabin stands obscured against the day ocean. A siren is switched off in a mansion far away. A well-dressed young woman opens the refrigerator and takes out a jar. She puts the lid on a pan and sets down a spoon. Through the library curtains, she observes a siren in the little cabin. She picks up the spoon happily and takes a pile of flowers from a shelf, and enters the mansion, extinguishing her vision with a tiny lantern. She skips along the smooth pavement away from the little cabin. She lowers herself elegantly off the metal ladder to the small plastic window. Outside the cabin, the gentle glow of the young woman’s lantern radiates over clean metal siding and a mantel clock adorned with ornaments. Releasing the metal railing, she ceases to descend the carpeted elevator, her lantern showing bright reflections over the glass ceilings. She turns on her lantern as she misses whispers from a closed corridor. The mouse disappears and hops beyond the corridor away from a creature revealed in a hammock. The young woman is wrapped in a bloom of red smoke. In the mansion, the jar spills. Timmy laughs aloud. Claire sits up beside her blanket. Mr. Adams follows his crew across a field. A cat climbs up. They descend a rocky gorge. The bright gleam of dusk disappears in the ocean. They all push the shoe which stops to rotate like a pinwheel. They are tossed away from it, rotating slower and slower, out of a dark shadow. Betty, Margaret, Claire, Timmy, and the cousins hold on and rise softly. Timmy looks down and hears Ms. Lawson, Fred, and Mr. Adams resting placidly up in the sky. Fred pulls Timmy down. They lead the group beneath a valley bottom hiding the cliff. The moon sets as they glance up at a minuscule city. Dancers confuse the animals as fewer buildings are demolished. Machines on wires glide safely high. Mr. Adams follows them from a cozy five-person cabin. Timmy smiles. Outside the enormous cabin, he hears a tiny exterior empty with tiles, chairs, and desks.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A metallic shield with the letters WB emerges from darkness near a heap of skulls. A large snake slithers from a skull and moves silently through a dark, overgrown cemetery past a winged skeleton statue. In the nearby cottage, a disheveled old man notices a light in the large, dilapidated house and angrily heads there with a torch. Inside, he hears voices, but a snake slips towards a figure in an armchair as a green flash engulfs him. Back in the cottage, the kettle boils, waking Harry, while Ron returns to sleep. Mr. Weasley guides a group, including Harry, Ron, Hermione, Ginny, and the twins, through a wood to a boot that spins them into bright light. They land near Mr. Diggory, Cedric, and Mr. Weasley, overlooking a campsite. As the sun rises, jugglers entertain, and people fly past on broomsticks. Mr. Weasley leads them to an unassuming tent, and Harry is amazed to find a vast interior.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: he sees a vast interior furnished with carpets beds and sofas Inside the tiny tent  Harry gawks  Mr Weasley leads them to a shabby twoman tent  People on broomsticks fly dangerously low  Jugglers entertain the crowd as even more tents are erected  The sun rises as they look down on a gigantic campsite  They follow the others along a cliff top overlooking the sea  Cedric helps Harry up  Cedric and Mr Weasley hiking sedately down to Earth  Harry looks up and sees Mr Diggory  Ron Harry and the twins let go and land heavily  Ginny Hermione  They are pulled with it spinning faster and faster into a bright light  They all touch the boot which begins to spin like a Catherine wheel  The faint glow of dawn appears in the sky  They climb a grassy slope  A boy drops down  Mr Weasley leads his group through a wood  Ron flops back onto his pillow  Harry jerks awake  In the cottage the kettle boils  The old man is engulfed in a flash of green light  The snake appears and slithers through the doorway towards a figure hidden in an armchair  He turns off his torch as he hears voices from an open doorway  Grasping the wooden banister he starts to climb the uncarpeted stairs his torch casting eerie shadows over the paneled walls  Inside the house the strong beam of the old man's torch flickers over dusty wooden paneling and a grandfather clock festooned with cobwebs  He hauls himself unsteadily up the stone steps to the large wooden door  He stumbles across the uneven ground towards the big house  He throws down the tea bag angrily and takes a bunch of keys from a hook and leaves the cottage lighting his way with a large torch  Through the kitchen window he notices a light in the big house  He takes the top off a teapot and picks up a tea bag  A disheveled old man lights the gas and puts on a kettle  A light is switched on in a cottage nearby  A huge dilapidated house stands silhouetted against the night sky  Metallic silver letters appear in the dark glowering sky  The snake slides past a stone statue of a skeleton with huge wings draped in a hooded cloak and holding a scythe  The reptile's lithe body shimmers as it glides swiftly along the uneven path  Flickering its tongue it slithers down onto a narrow path and moves silently between the gravestones in a dark and overgrown cemetery  From the grinning mouth of a skull emerges the head of a large snake  A heap of skulls and bones is piled high behind iron railings  A metallic shield with the letters WB moves slowly forward out of darkness
